intro: Troxistemon mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican troxistemon, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
